channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Flavor Flav is among women's hockey team fans outraged by presidential snub
item.description: The rapper, who also serves as the official "hype man" for multiple U.S. Olympic teams, invited the female hockey players to Las Vegas for a "real celebration."
item.content:encoded:
The rapper, who also serves as the official "hype man" for multiple U.S. Olympic teams, invited the female hockey players to Las Vegas for a "real celebration."

(Image credit: Andrew Milligan)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: The Louvre Museum's director has resigned in the wake of October's brazen jewel heist
item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron accepted Laurence des Cars' resignation as "an act of responsibility" at a moment when the Louvre needs security upgrades, modernization and other major projects.
item.content:encoded:
French President Emmanuel Macron accepted Laurence des Cars' resignation as "an act of responsibility" at a moment when the Louvre needs security upgrades, modernization and other major projects.

(Image credit: Emma Da Silva)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: TV critic David Bianculli offers a speed-date style rundown of what to watch
item.description: From The Pitt to A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, Bianculli recommends the best television has to offer right now.
item.content:encoded: From The Pitt to A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms, Bianculli recommends the best television has to offer right now.
item.dc:creator: David Bianculli

item.title: Years ago, novelist Tayari Jones snuck into a writing class. It changed her life
item.description: Jones' new novel, Kin, is set in 1950s Louisiana and Atlanta, and tells the story of two young women who grow up next door to each other without their mothers.
item.content:encoded:
Kin, follows two women growing up without their mothers in the 1950s.'/>

Jones' new novel, Kin, is set in 1950s Louisiana and Atlanta, and tells the story of two young women who grow up next door to each other without their mothers.

(Image credit: Julie Yarbrough)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Gavin Newsom says he's 'punching a bully back' when he trolls Trump
item.description: What does the Democratic leader see for himself in the years to come?
item.content:encoded: What does the Democratic leader see for himself in the years to come?
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: BAFTAs come under fire after guest with Tourette syndrome uses slur during ceremony
item.description: The BAFTAs were disrupted by an audience member with Tourette syndrome who shouted slurs at Black presenters. TV critic Eric Deggans examines the criticisms of the show's organizer and broadcaster.
item.content:encoded: The BAFTAs were disrupted by an audience member with Tourette syndrome who shouted slurs at Black presenters. TV critic Eric Deggans examines the criticisms of the show's organizer and broadcaster.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Black History Month: A look back at 2016 in film and TV
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with filmmaker Ava DuVernay about the film and TV of a decade ago as part of a Black History Month series about the year 2016.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with filmmaker Ava DuVernay about the film and TV of a decade ago as part of a Black History Month series about the year 2016.
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: BAFTAs apologize after guest with Tourette syndrome uses racial slur during ceremony
item.description: A man with Tourette syndrome shouted a racial slur and other offensive remarks during the BAFTA awards ceremony Sunday. The BBC did not edit out his outbursts in its delayed broadcast.
item.content:encoded:
A man with Tourette syndrome shouted a racial slur and other offensive remarks during the BAFTA awards ceremony Sunday. The BBC did not edit out his outbursts in its delayed broadcast.

(Image credit: Dominic Lipinski/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Kate Hudson on regret, rom-coms and finding a role that hits all the notes
item.description: Hudson always wanted to sing, but feared it would derail her acting career. Now she's up for an Oscar for her portrayal of a hairdresser who performs in a Neil Diamond tribute band in Song Sung Blue.
item.content:encoded:
Hudson always wanted to sing, but feared it would derail her acting career. Now she's up for an Oscar for her portrayal of a hairdresser who performs in a Neil Diamond tribute band in Song Sung Blue.

(Image credit: Kate Green)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: What NPR reporters will remember most about these Winter Olympics
item.description: NPR's reporters on the ground in Italy reflect on a far-flung, jam-packed Winter Olympics.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's reporters on the ground in Italy reflect on a far-flung, jam-packed Winter Olympics.

(Image credit: Maja Hitij)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
